Description: Head of female terracotta figure with hairdrawn back in a late Classical or early Hellenistic style. Mould-made. Broken at neck. Traces of white coating, painted?. Cypriot marl clay fabric with orange-red core and yellow-buff surfaces. Abundant fine black and white inclusions (<1mm). pencil marking on back.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ8 (probably)
Curator's comments: This figurine is labelled in pencil T8 (however both characters are unclear, the T could read +, the 8 is faint). If the reading is correct, this would designate this as coming from a context within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, from the excavations in 1885-1886. This was registered with pieces labelled T, Φ, or TAΦ, followed by a context number, designating these as coming from a context within the sanctuary of Aphrodite. All figurines sent out by the Egypt Exploration Fund in 1911 to various museums appear to have come from Petrie's excavation of the Aphrodite sanctuary. This figure is highly likely to have been excavated within the temenos of the Aphrodite sanctuary.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.382) (Phase 3)
